subject: Redfish: Support Host Log Entries
commitMessage:
Redfish: Support Host Log Entries

This commit support to present host log entries through redfish.

The host log entry contains host's console output information,
such as boot logs or Linux kernel messages printed to the system console,
and each entry will have an unique ID which is created by timestamp.

RedfishServiceValidator results:
  /redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/HostLogger
    pass: 4
    passGet: 1
    skipOptional: 9

  /redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/HostLogger/Entries
    pass: 30
    passGet: 1
    skipOptional: 1

  /redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/HostLogger/Entries/<str>
    pass: 8
    passGet: 1
    skipOptional: 14

Sample Outputs:
  curl -k -H "X-Auth-Token: $token" -X GET https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/HostLogger/Entries
{
  "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/HostLogger/Entries/",
  "@odata.type": "#LogEntryCollection.LogEntryCollection",
  "Description": "Collection of HostLogger Entries",
  "Members": [
    {
      "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/HostLogger/Entries/56",
      "@odata.type": "#LogEntry.v1_4_0.LogEntry",
      "Created": "1970-01-01T00:00:56+00:00",
      "EntryType": "Event",
      "Id": "56",
      "Message": "Host console log : >>> Log collection started at 1970-01-01 00:00:56\n ",
      "MessageArgs": [
        ">>> Log collection started at 1970-01-01 00:00:56\n"
      ],
      "MessageId": "OpenBMC.0.1.HostLogger",
      "Name": "HostLogger Entries",
      "Severity": "OK"
    },
  ...
  ],
  "Members@odata.count": 28,
  "Name": "HostLogger Entries"
}

Signed-off-by: SpencerKu <Spencer.Ku@quantatw.com>
Change-Id: Ib9465b6fbf1ec4f8e6b4236e2eef7f675a958122

Patch Set 10:

(4 comments)

Abandoned

Since we use new method(phosphor-hostlogger + journal + rsyslog + bmcweb) to implement host log entry, abandon the old PR. New PR link: https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/42949
Can we fix the warning?
Yes, the warning will be fixed in next patch.
Fixed in patch 4
Please check for and handle errors.
Done
If gzopen returns an error, this will do the wrong thing.
check gzopen on above line 16~23
please use std::array.
Done
Please don't ignore return codes.
Done
Need to check lengths.  all of line is not necessarily valid.
Done
Doesn't look used directly.
Remove the include.
Doesn't need to be static.  Also, this is only used in one place.  Just inline it on line 1693
Done

please use the bmcweb macros intended for logging things like this.

Also, this should return an error to the calling scope.
replace logging method to BMCWEB_LOG_ERROR and return false.
Please don't use exceptions here, use the other constructor for directory_iterator.
using filesystem as the new constructor.
Missing length checks, but also please don't hardcode it to magic numbers this way.
Using another method to get timestamp and message string without using magic number.

Please don't use regex for this.  There is in progress work to remove all regexes from bmcweb, as std::regex is quite slow, and has mediocre memory usage constraints.

Please use a combination of direct character matching and from_chars to parse this.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/35522 is removing std::regex
Got it, we remove the regex and use get_time to check the timestamp format.
inline.
modify bool to void.
Please do this in the calling scope, to make more clear what's going on, and don't use a magic number.
Done
Why does this function need to return a status at all if it can't fail.
modify bool to void and remove the return.
This is almost certainly incorrect.  Please verify with the redfish spec.
Thank you for the comment, modify the entity privileges.
Please declare variables where they're used.
Done
This should return, and not continue.
The "fillHostLoggerEntryJson" function has been modified to void.
Why is this patchset important?  What changes would a user expect to see once this is merged?
I rewrite the commit, if there is some other information need to be added here please let me know, thank you.
Any reason we don't enable this by default?

is phosphor-hostlogger used widely by the community? 
I know we aren't using but have talked about using it.

I didn't realize IBM systems didn't have that turned on yet.  In general, my preference is to have everything enabled by default, then disable what we don't use for the systems that don't support it.  We should really get better at recipe packageconfig options for these things.
The reason i set the value to disable here is that this feature is depend on phosphor-hostlogger and the package doesn't use widely. Should i set the value to enable by default?
I enabled this feature by default now. If there is any incorrect please let me know, thank you.
I think you did the right thing.

>  general, my preference is to have everything enabled by default, then disable what we don't use for the systems that don't support it. 

I see a lot of "disabled" in the lines above. I guess I would have voted for disabled but I am fine as is
Please declare this within GZFile::gzGetLine.
Done
Please pass by std::filesystem::path or std::string&
Done
Thank you for the feedback, we choose to use buf.resize(lineLimit) to build it.
Please use line.size() here for consistency.
Done
Is this check required?  Can't lines be empty?
Yes, i think it can be the empty line here, the check is not correct. And since we use buf.resize(lineLimit) to replace line array, we remove the code here.
This should be inline, not static.
Done

Please use the overload of this that accepts an error_code object.

Also, please read DEVELOPING.md for the bmcweb exception policy.
i think i misunderstanding here before, thank you for the suggestion.
missing inline
Done
Please simply construct this with the correct size, rather than constructing, then immediately modifying.
Done
This object gets constructed and filled, then doesn't get used?  I feel like I'm missing something here.
Here we just use this to check is the timestamp format correct, then pass timestamp to  "getUniqueEntryID" and "fillHostLoggerEntryJson" to get ID and fill "Created" level.
Unless I'm mistaken, tmpTimestamp can be completely deleted, and timestamp can just be filled on line 1721 instead of assigned to the string_view.
The original idea here is that we want to check timestamp format first, then assign the value to it. But yes, we can filled it on line 1721 directly.
Done
this should be inline, not static.
Done
We should probably talk about naming.  HostLogger doesn't really seem in line with what OpenBMC/Redfish tends to use for naming.  Console Log seems more consistent, but I'd have to think about it.
Will "HostConsole" be a better naming of this feature?
This message ID doesn't exist.  You'll need to add a registry for it.
I am working on it and will be pushed in next patch.
After research about the MessageID, i think we will not use the message ID to log message to redfish log. So remove the "MessageID" and "MessageArgs" level.
MessageId is required for Event type logs.
I register a MessageId for HostLogger.
Please state in your commit message how you landed on these privilege levels.  They still look incorrect to me when I compare to the Redfish registry.
The setting here is referenced to LogServices/EventLog. I will check the privilege more detail if it is incorrect.

Please remove.

BMCWEB_ENABLE_DEBUG is the same a enabling logging.
Remove "BMCWEB_ENABLE_DEBUG" here
nit:  If you need these files in reverse order, could we just sort them that way up front?
Modify the sorting function here
Why are we defining a copy operator here?  I suspect you meant to delete it?
Yes, i want to delete it. Modify the code here.
Error codes should be checked before starting the loop.
Done
